content: The **Singapore national ice hockey team** is the national men's [ice hockey](/wiki/Ice_hockey) team of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The team is controlled by the [Singapore Ice Hockey Association](/wiki/Singapore_Ice_Hockey_Association) and a member of the [International Ice Hockey Federation](/wiki/International_Ice_Hockey_Federation) (IIHF) since 2 May 1996. As of 2025, Singapore is ranked 50th in the [IIHF World Ranking](/wiki/IIHF_World_Ranking) and 15th in the Asian ranking. Singapore made its [World Championship](/wiki/Ice_Hockey_World_Championships) debut in (/wiki/2022_IIHF_World_Championship_Division_IV), and has also played in the [Challenge Cup of Asia](/wiki/IIHF_Asia_and_Oceania_Championship), a regional tournament for lower-tier hockey national teams in [Asia](/wiki/Asia). Until the [2024 Division III Group B tournament](/wiki/2024_IIHF_World_Championship_Division_III#Group_B_tournament), they are unable to participate in the IIHF World Championship tournament in 2025 due to the [JCube](/wiki/JCube) Ice Rink (the only indoor Olympic-size ice rink in the city-state) closed in 2023, and cannot meet their minimum participation standards. ## Tournament record ### World Championship -
